Besides do I really have time to go and touch up tons of photos when my other cameras don't have this problem?  Anyone else have this problem and find a setting combination to fix it?Everything else about it is great for a pocket point&shoot;, just don't use it for night-time photos of people without great lighting.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: TJJ
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera.  It takes great pictures.  The videos are pretty good.  I was looking for a camera that would fit in my pocket so that I could carry it everywhere.  I was a little picking at the auto focus and image quality.  I tried several cameras before picking this one.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD790IS
Reviews.Author: E. L. Woods Jr.
Reviews.Content: Nice look and feel to this camera.  Great display size.  Takes wonderful pics with little effort.  IS feature seems better than my Panasonic DMC-FZ7.  One minor issue....wheel for adjusting scenes setting takes a fine touch to operate, esp if you have large fingers or a heavy touch.  Overall a nice small camera for easy carrying and everyday photography.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: J. K. Jones "world traveler"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Canon PowerShot SD790IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom.  It is easy to operate, pictures are unbelievably clear, it has given me the ability to see the world if a completely different way.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Canon camera. Great pics, easy to use and fast!
Reviews.Author: Mikehill33
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera in every aspect.Startup time is great, menus are logical and clear.Picture quality is phenomenal, and all lighting will give great results.Excellent camera for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Julianne Biggerstaff "Jules"
Reviews.Content: I went from having a sony camera (which I hated and broke within 2 months) and instead of going through the hassle to replace it, I just went back to Canon which I love and read all the reviews.  This camera seemed to be the best and it definitely is.  I love it!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Little Getting Used To, But Perfect
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: It took me a little bit to switch from my old pentax, but this camera is overall superb. The battery outlasts anything I have had before, the screen is bright and easy to see from any angle, definitely worth the money. The color switch and accent tools work really well if you figure out how to use them. I was worried about the buttons being flat, and maybe they would be hard to push, but its not a problem at all. I like how you zoom on it, and the shooting switch on the top right is helpful. The perfect camera.

Reviews.Title: The best for your money in its price range
Reviews.Author: Norberto H. Vergani
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur photographer and this is my fourth digital camera.  I've had two Olympus and one Nikon before and this is by far the best of all them.Very good camera all around, it fulfills all expectations that you can have for a camera in its price range.Excellent picture quality in all light conditions, easy to use, good battery life and very good movies in 60FPS, 640x480 resolution are among its much pros. It complies with all manufacturer's specifications, although perhaps you don't like the lack of a viewfinder or the poor optical zoom (only 3X).The only con I've found so far: the wheel texture is too smooth and sometimes it's difficult to turn around, especially if your fingers are pretty big (the Nikon wheel, with its radial texture is much easier to turn).In a nutshell, an excellent mid range camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent performer
Reviews.Author: Sohail Khwaja
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing this camera and I am very happy to have made this choice. I bought this camera for as a gift and coupled it with a SanDisk Extreme III 4GB SDHC card. The start-up time is almost instantaneous and the cycle-time between shots is also superb. I really like the circular controller on the back as its tactile nature is very manageable. It focuses super fast and with its face detection feature you can see right away how many people will be in focus. It has a very useful zoom range, while not ultra-wide for close ups it does an excellent job. I don't have the time to write about all the useful features this camera has, rest assured it's a very well thought out compact and stands out in the sea of cutesy and trendy models from this and other manufacturers.

Reviews.Title: canon SD790IS
Reviews.Author: David W. Walter "dwalt"
Reviews.Content: I lost my Canon 750 and replaced it with the SD790IS and I like it even more than the 750 which was a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but one major flaw
Reviews.Author: Enigma
Reviews.Content: I like the SD790 due to it's compact, but yet, sturdy frame.  It's fast too!My only complaint is the rotating wheel.  Mine is stiff and hard to spin unless I use my nails.  This rotating wheel is not very accurate at all.  Sometimes I would rotate it 360 degrees and it will do nothing.  I know they improved the wheel in newer models (SD880, etc.)  Does anybody have this difficult time rotating the wheels?  I don't know if it's just my camera because when I went to a couple of stores to check it out, they were spinning more freely.It was hard to write this review because I couldn't decide between 5 stars or 3 stars, so I gave it a 4.  Many of the features have to be used with the wheel.

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Powershot S2 IS for years and have had great success with it in a variety of lighting conditions.  The camera has a slow shutter lag but the images were sharp and the zoom was quite useful at times.  I purchased the new 790IS for a trip to Africa because it was more suitable for travel conditions and because it still had built in optical stabilization.  The image quality suffers from over correction.  The flash is so focal that images blur from the reflection.  Also disconcerting is the enclosure for the mini-USB connection which is quite flimsy and the placement of the directional buttons are annoying as they sit precisely where your thumb naturally settles when you go to take a picture.  There is a lot to like about this camera but the image quality, combined with the user interface makes for a less than appealing camera.For the number of years that have passed since the S2 came out, I would've thought that compact digital camera quality would have improved more.  Unfortunately, I'm tempted to sell this camera and return to using my S2.  I'm still a loyal canon user, but now chastened, I'm certainly more wary of their products.

Reviews.Title: Well-Built Point 'n Shoot
Reviews.Author: David Peters
Reviews.Content: I like the 790 because it's sturdy & feels finished, is quick to switch between modes, and because it's well-priced for what it can do.  So far my only complaint is that the selector wheel is tricky to use because it's too slippery.  In order to get the wheel to turn you have to push hard to get enough friction but this amount of pressure is close to pushing the underlying buttons.  A rubberized surface would have worked well here.

Reviews.Title: It's Canon!!!
Reviews.Author: Daniel A. Arias "RoOts, Rock, Reggae"
Reviews.Content: come on, we all know there are many companies out there selling their brand name and not their quality. This is one of the few exceptions. This camera was for a gift but i already own the Canon SD870IS. I will recommend most not to say all Canon products.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: K. Ruder
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera.  Very easy to use, even for a someone who can't operate anything.  The screen has a great picture, the bigger screen is definately worth it.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT CAMERA!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Arenas Lange
Reviews.Content: This is a awesome camera!!! i bought this like a month ago.. i went to a trip in bahamas and the pics are TOP QUALITY!!! my girlfriend has a sony dsc t500 and making a comparision the CANON IS A CLEAR WINNER...if you are thinking about this camera trust me.. BUY IT!!! is GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Delivers yet again
Reviews.Author: A. Kohli
Reviews.Content: Canon has created just about the perfect point n shoot camera.I owned this model's predecessor, the SD750, and I must say I was thoroughly impressed by the picture quality. The images are sharp, full of color, and readily usable, which is good for me who doesn't process them a lot on the computer.Though I likes the build quality on SD750 a bit better, this camera isn't bad either, considering whats on offer on the market right now. They've tweaked the design, and though I'm not a huge fan of the big playback buttons, I do like the scroll wheel.My only nitpick with this camera is that its not meant for sports photography, or for taking multiple pictures together. Also, the flash is a bit on the weak side.But, with its price dropping even more($20 the week after I ordered), it sure is one hot deal :)

Reviews.Title: This camera rocks!
Reviews.Author: R. Adams
Reviews.Content: My old Canon S410 was getting long in the teeth, so I dug in to research suitable replacements. The megapixel war is something that I'll never understand, and this is especially true in the P&S; arena. 10MP is plenty. The SD790 is nicely built, and the photo quality is quite good. It also appears to be pretty weather sealed as well, as the entire back of the camera was splashed with seawater, and after several months, has not caused any problems. Battery life is very good, and with minimal use of the flash, can easily power the camera for several days. I highly recommend this camera as a very small, portable P&S; that takes great pictures, and is easy to carry around. Let's face it - if you don't have a camera with you, you get no picture. I'm a working pro, and played a bit with the G9 & G10, but found them to be too big. I don't often want to haul my full kit around when hiking or just knocking around town, and the SD790 is a great way to snap quick pics without hauling a ton of gear.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera For The Price!!!
Reviews.Author: Chad Thomas Schmall "Chad Thomas Schmall"
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this camera is awesome! I have been looking for a new camera to buy for months and in the end I chose this one and I am not disappointed. The Canon Powershot 790IS packs a lot of punch into a small, yet comfortable to hold, point and shoot camera! Trust me if you want an excellent camera under $200 this is the one to beat! So put it in you cart an proceed to checkout :)

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Digital
Reviews.Author: Palmetto
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent point and shoot digital camera. There are a lot of optional manual settings OR you can go fully automatic -- depending on your skill level and how much control you're looking for. It's a nice size to take with you just about anywhere.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT camera and price
Reviews.Author: C. GRECO "www.ZenCrystals.com"
Reviews.Content: Researched MANY cameras and online reviews and finally decided on the Canon Powershot SD790 IS and am so pleased. It's takes GREAT pics, is VERY easy to just point-n-shoot, yet also has lots of great features that I am sure will come in very handy. Haven't had time to read the manual yet, but that's the best thing about this camera... you can start using it immediately WITHOUT having to spend time with the manual.Love it, love it, love it...[..]

Reviews.Title: Great compact
Reviews.Author: Ryan Gelinas
Reviews.Content: I previously had the SD750 and absolutely loved that camera.  Unfortunately, it was stolen when my car was broken in to.  I ended up not replacing it 1 for 1 because the SD790IS was due out shortly, and so I picked it up locally the first weekend it hit stores.  Compared to the 750, the 790 is a little bit thicker and perhaps a little bit heavier, but it's still a good overall compact design.  Image stabilization was really the only feature I felt was lacking from the 750, so it was a welcome upgrade.  I have always loved the image quality of the Canon PowerShots compared to other point and shoot cameras, and the SD790 is no exception.  Overall, highly recommended.. even my Mom bought one after seeing mine!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Sd790IS
Reviews.Author: Colin Green
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter and she loves it. I checked it against the competition and thought that it had the best specs and functionality. The LCD screen is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Best Choice
Reviews.Author: W. Suhartono "tony the tiger"
Reviews.Content: This camera is definitely the best camera yet for the best price in the market to day,small,nice looking and easy to use and take great pictures

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: K. Evans
Reviews.Content: Gave this item as a gift and they loved it!  I've used this camera before and it was easy to use without having to read the manual.  Great quality pictures too!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD790IS
Reviews.Author: S. McMurtrey "loves books"
Reviews.Content: My brother-in-law loves this camera. It's small, and easy to use. It takes beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Read Everything
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: So I read every review possible on all the cameras I was debating between...and this won. Boy, am I glad I chose it. It did not let me down! I am thoroughly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: good cmera
Reviews.Author: Xiaohong Wang "mtrainbow"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera. You can shoot a lot beautiful pictures. The only not good point is that you need spend some time to figure out all functions under different modle you want.

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: BE Babe
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony Cybershot DSCP-200 (7.2 mp) and I always thought it was me, not the camera, that was contributing to my blurry shots.  At any given time, two-thirds of the photos I had taken with that camera would always come out blurry.  I decided to give the Canon brand a try on advice from my sister, who is always raving about our mom's PowerShot.  When I started using this camera, I was absolutely amazed with the sharpness and clarity of the photographs.  On a recent trip to Las Vegas, I took pictures from a moving car going 50+ mph and the photos looked as though I had taken them standing still.  It's honestly a fantastic camera.  The larger LCD screen is awesome -- no need for a viewfinder.  I did a lot of research prior to purchasing this camera and it was definitely a difficult choice with all of the other Canons out there, but I am now a loyal Canon user.  And you can't beat Amazon's price.  Anywhere else, this camera is selling for $100 more.  If you want something that will take clear, crisp, and beautiful shots, give this camera a try.

Reviews.Title: Improvement over the 770IS
Reviews.Author: N. Ahrens
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera and the pictures are sharper in close up, than the SD770IS.  This is a better camera, if you don't mind the fact that is has no view finder.Nancy,  Indiana.

Reviews.Title: It's a very good camera
Reviews.Author: T. Q. Nguyen "NQT"
Reviews.Content: OK, first of all, I think it's pretty silly to give this camera a not so good review because you dropped it, especially when it's on with the zoom extended. It's like saying a car doesn't have good paint after you crashed it.The camera takes very good pictures. We bought this camera to replace an old Nikon which was working very well as well. So far we're very happy with it because it responses fast enough to catch many precious moments of our now 6-moth-old daughter, and is definitely a big improvement in picture quality compared to the old Nikon. In my opinion, the control is not overly complicated. I figured out how to use it (of course with just basic functions) without consulting the manual. Yes, it doesn't have a  view finder, but let's be honest, if you have a LCD that big, what are the chances that you will use the view finder instead of looking at the LCD?I would highly recommended this camera to anybody who want to have an excellent family-use camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS
Reviews.Author: Duc
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift, although I use it , it isn't my personal camera. Canon seems to have most all the glitches in Digital photography worked out with these SD series cameras. This is the second one I have purchased this year that I have given for gifts and they seem to do a very good job . I upgraded to Extreme III 4G cards in both of them and it really helps . Canon's quality is among the top shelf cameras on the market ,so IMHO , you can't go wrong for the $$ spent. Great camera!!! Merry Christmas .

Reviews.Title: best pocket camera ever
Reviews.Author: Hen "Hen"
Reviews.Content: Our old canon SD660 was stolen in Shanghai last month by a pickpocket.  We were devastated but upon return to the USA, we immediately knew we would buy another canon.  We chose the SD790 because of the 3 in screen and other enhanced features.  We couldn't be happier.  Ironically, we were glad we were forced to buy this new camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures!
Reviews.Author: B. Shah "Beebop"
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed about this camera was the quality of the pictures. They are truly great for this class of camera. As with other Canon point-and-shoots, the controls are intuitive. Overall the camera is great.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera
Reviews.Author: P. Leonard
Reviews.Content: I did a ton of research and ended up with this camera.  I am very very happy.  The photo quality is fantastic.  The battery life is wonderful.  My only wish is that the shutter delay was shorter but I'm getting used to it.  My last camera was film, lol, so any shutter delay is too long for me.  Menus are very easy to use and understand, bad shots are easy to delete on the fly, giant view screen is great.  I just love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice CAm
Reviews.Author: R. Kho "Ram Khor"
Reviews.Content: I have a sony ... this is much better ... sony turns head when you taking the pictureCanon turns heads when you look at the pictures on the computer... or prints ..

Reviews.Title: Canon SD790IS
Reviews.Author: ellieg
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a recent vacation.  I am a novice but was able to get terrific photos.  Imagine what I'll be able to do after I read the manual!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Thorne
Reviews.Content: This is the first point and shoot purchased since 2002. After reading numerous reviews both on amazon.com as well as newegg.com, going into Best Buy and playing with all point and shoots available (then reading their reviews), and playing with a friends Canon SD 770, we decided to purchase this model.Our reasons being:1) All point and shoot Canons have the Color Accent feature, which is way too much fun to play with.2) The image quality, in our opinion, is equal, if not far superior to all other models we played with. The color was crisper, the image was clearer (mostly due to the IS), and the screen larger.3) The price off Amazon.com was by far lower than any other retailer. It put the camera under $200, which was competitively priced, and allowed us to purchase a camera with more features than any other in that range.So far the battery life has been good, the computer software easy to use, and the camera operation simple to learn. Reading the manual is a must if you plan to do much more than just use automatic.All in all, no issues, good price, and fun to use!

Reviews.Title: excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Hiteshkumar Patel
Reviews.Content: I have recently purchased this cannon sd790is camera. It has fulfilled all my demands and I am completely satisfied with it. It has excellent picture quality. It is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon 10mp
Reviews.Author: John Kelly
Reviews.Content: I have owned many Canon products over the years,but this one tops it all.  10 mp with a 3" screen display with an image stabilizer,and precision manufactured in Japan.all for about $200.Great camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Nancy R. Zuellig
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera (Canon Power Shot SD790) about a month now and just want to say that I love it! It takes great pics and is easy to use. I like the size of it and how it looks (which I didn't expect to like)... nice and comfortable to hold, easy to take in a pocket or purse. I've had no problem with the wheel on the back ... I still have to study what all of the features/icons are used for yet, so at this time, I am not using it to its full potential. Uploading the pictures to the computer is easy. Takes good pics and of course I LOVE the size of the viewfinder!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: T. Walker "OK girl"
Reviews.Content: I'm a hobbiest/pro photographer.Going on vacation I did not want to drag my large/heavy canon lens around. I am picky enough that I still wanted quality pictures.  This little camera is great.  The large screen is worth the money.  The controls are small and a little slippery(the rotating wheel) but once you are used to it you can quickly change settings.  There are many features I will most likey never use but with some creativity you could have fun with it.  I had no trouble with battery life.  I took around 850 pictures in 10 days so it was used a lot.  I had to charge every night but it took pics solid all day on one charge.  (I did not use flash very often)Get a car charger.  I have a universal charger that will charge the batteries for both my cameras while on the road.

Reviews.Title: Excellent photo's and overall excellent product with great price and 8GB memory card for $299 shipped
Reviews.Author: D. Goodman
Reviews.Content: Excellent photo's and overall excellent product with great price and 8GB memory card for $299 shipped

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: BB "BB"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera except for the little wheel where you can select the picture setting. It's a little awkward to use. Love the big LCD and the small size of the camera. Takes awesome photos!

Reviews.Title: Would Not Recommend
Reviews.Author: joyride
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in February 2009 after much research.  The camera takes pretty good pictures, although we did have many instances of blurry photos.  The biggest issue, however, is the construction.  The screws that hold on the side panel (which is what the wrist strap is attached to) fell out, releasing the panel & wrist strap from the body and the camera fell to the ground, causing some damage (warping) of the right corner and body.  On careful inspection, we also noticed the screws on the bottom of the unit were coming loose.  Then just a few days ago while using the camera, we noticed that the switch that allows you to switch between camera and video mode was loose and would no longer move.  Now the camera is stuck on picture mode and cannot be switched to video mode.  I expected much better quality from Cannon and would NOT purchase this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Z. Ahmed
Reviews.Content: I was always a Sony person and never like the look and feel of Canon. But the end result of this camera are far better then any Sony Camera I have ever used. It may not have the touch screen feature just like some new Sony Cameras but pictures taken from this camera are just awesome......

Reviews.Title: My Canon Experience
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: I purposely waited 6 months after purchasing this camera so I could properly review it.  This is my third digital camera.  My first was an early Canon which I was very happy with.  I updated it then with the Kodak V550 and unfortunately in the future I'm afraid all of my digital camera purchases will be measured against it.  I LOVED the Kodak V550 and only sought out a new camera when it died after years of being overworked.  Ok, back on task here. I researched heavily before purchasing the SD790.  My purpose was to find the best price for decent quality photos in a camera that would fit in my purse or pocket.  My main objects of photography are family and travel.  Pros: There were several cameras of which I decided to take a closer look.  Ultimately, and I'm a little embarrassed to admit this, I decided on this particular model because of it's looks.  It is beautiful and sleek just as the V550 was.  I prefer the square lines and simplicity of the buttons over ugly dial knobs and rounded corners.  I have been happy with the quality of the photos and video.  I'm sorry to say that I've not ever installed the software so am not qualified to comment on it.  I use another photo software.  I love the large viewing area.  I ordered an extra battery but so far have not had to use it.  The battery life is very good.  Cons: No viewfinder. I don't like not having one.  I rarely used it before so thought I could do without it but when you need it, you need it.  I also don't like having to remove the battery and place it in a separate charger.  This may be common place but both of my previous cameras were chargable without removing the battery.  This is my biggest dislike which has nothing to do with quality but convenience. Compared to my Kodak, the menu is harder to figure out but with more use I'm sure I'll get used to it.  I can happily recommend this camera.  I'd give it a 5* on looks alone but the little things I don't like about it keep me from doing so.

Reviews.Title: A Tale of Three Treasures!
Reviews.Author: Ms_Ladi "...just wandering the world."
Reviews.Content: This review is a combination of three:Canon PowerShot SD950IS 12.1MP (Titanium)Canon PowerShot SD770IS 10MP (Silver)Canon PowerShot SD790IS 10MPI first purchased the Canon SD950, and after loonnnggg shipping from Jr.com, I received it and tried it out.  The camera is much bigger than the SD500 that I upgraded from--even though it's got so many bells and whistles.  One thing about Canon that's got my eyebrow raised:  Why the big font as if we can't read?The Image Stabilization is a wonderful thing, right along with the face detection.  It even focused on an enlarged print of a little girl!  The 3.7 zoom is nothing to frown at either.  ISO is easier to set now so one can play around with the settings...The camera is made for "big hands" and it took me about two weeks of off and on shooting to get used to it.  The 12MP quality is okay, and I didn't have to get used to too much new button placement.  One thing I didn't like is the play button.  I felt I had to really push my finger on the play button in order to view my photos.  It annoyed me enough to see what else was out there.The Canons SD770 and SD790 were next on my list.  Even though they were "only" 10MP, they had newer technology from Canon:  Motion Detection and Infinity and cute buttons in all new small packages.SD770IS(Silver)First the SD770.  This was a nice small camera!  Not cheap feeling at all, Canon packed everything but the kitchen sink in there.  I like the "Infinity" setting that the SD950 didn't have.  Also, I have the silver version and it's nice, small, sleek, and takes great pictures.  I didn't like the way the battery cover was not spring loaded.  Also, either it was this particular camera or the 770 in general, but it seemed like I had to "dig" for the battery and SDHC card once put in.  Yes, it's compact, hefty, and full of bells and whistles, but it was...kinda boring.  Maybe because the silver color didn't have the pizazz of the black version that I'd read reviews on.  Moving on to the SD790...SD790ISBigger camera!  Compared to the 770, it's a giant!  The same size as the 950 except in a square/cube like form.  The 950 is curvy, while the 790 is sleek and boxy (not sure if that's an oxymoron or not!).  The 790 also has a new button format that I'm not sure if I like or not.  I really enjoyed the SD500's button placement and while I can appreciate a "play" button...why not make it easy access instead of having to constantly press the button down?  I'm thinking that the play buttons will eventually wear out.  The big screen is nice, and even though I haven't used a viewfinder since...ever, it would be nice to "just have".  So the lack of a viewfinder is a potential bummer.  You never know when you gotta smear your nose on the photo screen to take pic!  lol  Also, the 790 is a fingerprint magnet.I tried to take the same pictures with all the cameras, but couldn't always (morning/evening, different zoom, etc.).  Both the 770 and 790 have high ISO settings (as did the 950), but I didn't even use anything that high previously!  All the pictures came out great.  Even my crappy pictures of my messy coffee table were clear and colorful!  One issue I had with all three cameras was the color accent setting.  It seemed as if I got better black and white/one color photos from my SD500 than either of these cameras.  I have to do a lot more tweaking.  However, it could be just because of the balances of the colors and the lighting effects in my environment.If I just had to choose based on portability, photos, looks, bells/whistles, ease of use, I would go crazy trying to decide.  Both cameras are amazingly small!  The thing that keeps me wondering about the 770 is, "how can they fit all these specs in this TINY camera!??  But, I'm a sucker for good looks, so the scale points back to the SD790!  True it's bigger than the 770, but it's still small considering the screen.  I always take great care of my electronics, so I'm not so worried about fingerprints.  If the button issue upsets me extremely, then I'll just upgrade to Canon's latest and greatest in 6-8 months.One more thing:  I purchased the SanDisk 4 GB Extreme III SDHC Card w/ MicroMate USB Reader and it gets 900ish pictures on the 10MP versions at the highest settings.Either way, can't wait to take pics on the new SD790.  I feel that although all three are great, the 790 has that sleekness with Canon's new technology all in one package.Get out, purchase any of these cams and you'd be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Less than 2 years in, black screen of death
Reviews.Author: Art Books & More
Reviews.Content: Got this as a Christmas gift 2008 as a replacement for a Nikon Coolpix that used awful AA rechargeable batteries.  I LOVED this new camera!  The battery is a square liOn(?) that charges easily and hold a charge forever.  I also loved the wide angle lens.  HOWEVER, about a month ago (September 2010) my screen started going black... No image would show up through the lens although the menu items would still show up.  After searching the net it turns out this is a COMMON problem with Canons!  It's the CCD sensor that Canon used from Sony!  Unfortunately this model isn't covered under Canon's policy!  I got a pre-paid mailing label from them, sent the camera into their US repair facility outside Chicago, and was notified within a week that it would cost me $129 to repair.  Forget it!  I'd rather spend the money on a new camera!  With the speed of technological advances it just makes more sense than repairing the old one.  Very disappointed as I LOVED this camera :(

Reviews.Title: Horrible AWB, no better than 5 YR old Sony this camera replaced.
Reviews.Author: Gift Recipient
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy taking a good landscape photo, get used to the manual exposure control and white balance profiles because this camera will blow out the sky in all but perfect conditions.  Total disappointment for the cost.  Comparing images I took with my old 5MP Sony and this new Canon look identical in quality.  Either the Sony was that good, or this Canon is that bad.  To be somewhat fair, I bought this camera when it just came out and have not bothered to look for a firmware update, but the performance is on par with today's $100-150 Nikon/ Casio/ Canon/ Samsung/ etc Best Buy specials.

Reviews.Title: Died after 6 months with "lens error"
Reviews.Author: S. Greene
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera while it worked; after 6 months just stopped though with a "lens error."  I did some web searching and discovered that this is evidently a common problem with this model, and unrecoverable.  Normally would be a simple warranty issue, but I bought it in Australia while on vacation and it appears that the warranty is only valid down there.  Oh well.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: choidoc
Reviews.Content: I am a "point and shoot" type of photographer and just need the basics.  This is a great camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Bernard Darko
Reviews.Content: As an amature photographer taking pictures of family,friends and interesing places this camera is the best. I like its portability - I am able to carry it anywhere. I like the instructional manual - It's straight to the ponit. The camera itself is very easy to use. I will recommend this camera to friends.

Reviews.Title: not a bad little camera
Reviews.Author: gman
Reviews.Content: i have used this camera for little over a monthe now and i am pretty pleased with it. the colors are bright and beautiful and has a lot of neat features on this little guy. however, some of the pictures comes out blurry. other than that great camera.

Reviews.Title: compact & amazing
Reviews.Author: S. Woodside "foto guru"
Reviews.Content: This small "Elph" creates high quality pix (10Mp), and the image stabilization makes using it almost idiot proof.  Lots of features, but easy and effective in AUTO mode.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: Book Seeker
Reviews.Content: I own several cameras but this is my go-to one, It is simply the best. It's easy to use and has great features. You cannot go wrong with this camera, worth every penny. If you are looking for great pictures and an easy to use reliable product, you have found it. I woud not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Summer Star
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera used here on Amazon.com over 3 years ago and it's been the greatest little camera I've ever used in my life. Since I got this camera taking pics and video is fun so I have been doing it all the time.  I even bought a used one for my brother as a Christmas gift.  This camera takes beautiful pics, video and is so easy to use.  Also, the camera has never failed me yet in any way.  It takes pics and video just like a professional amera but you don't have the expense or the bulk.  It fits easily into a purse or pocket or a small light camera pouch.  It does come with one too by the way.  You just can't go wrong with the Cannon PowerShot SD790is.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: L. Luerssen
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera since the later part of 2008, I think.  I bought it to take on vacation and use it I did.  I keep it on hand around the house to quick take a picture of whatever unusual is going on.  Some who have reviewed it didn't like the options wheel on it.  I have no problem with it.  There have been many compliments on the quality of the pictures taken by this camera.  I really like the software that comes with it, too.  Although, I have had to buy a new computer with a different OS.  There have been some problems along that line.  But all in all, this is a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Did not honestly describe product
Reviews.Author: l
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and it came with a fake canon battery and a lead which did not fit camera to transferphotos onto computer. Don't deal with this person. Dishonest.

Reviews.Title: Good condition
Reviews.Author: parallelalangus
Reviews.Content: It arrived much faster than expected (6 days to Hawaii). The scratches on the camera are acceptable. The camera is really 100 percent functional as the seller demonstrated, but one noticeable problem is that every picture it takes has a thin blue line on the left side of the image. This problem may caused by several small scratches on the lens which the seller did not mentioned. But the problem is really hard to find, so generally, acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Works fine, i have it now for a couple of years and its still great, never fails easy to use and very relighble.

Reviews.Title: too bad they are discontinued
Reviews.Author: jay sears
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, my friends were so impressed that several purchased the exact item, and they love it too. About the only place to find one now is on Ebay, and no new ones are available

Reviews.Title: broken
Reviews.Author: Sassy
Reviews.Content: When I recieved this product the power button was broken. That was not part of its description so I was not happy and returned it.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS
Reviews.Author: Vicki L. Grant
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera, and takes excellent pictures, BUT I found it to be difficult to use. So many settings, and all I wanted was to just take the picture! This is a better camera for someone more serious about photography.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: J. C. Schaefer "Fr. Frog"
Reviews.Content: Bought one some time ago for my wife to use.  Picture quality is excellent (am running it at 6MP rather than 10).  Only complaint is that videos created by this camera are very jerky in playback on anything other than the camera.  However, for some reason if you copy the video file to a CD they play fine on other players.

Reviews.Title: One day I will retire it... but not THIS day!
Reviews.Author: Pangaea
Reviews.Content: I recently started thinking about getting a new compact digital camera, since my PowerShot SD790IS has been with me since 2009-- in that time, it's been to Afghanistan (twice, deployed), Germany (vacation), horseback riding, hiking, and on various training exercises at various locations in the US... And it still works like a champ! After reading reviews for newer and different models (I won't waiver from the Canon brand though), I've decided that despite its cosmetic scratches, I'm keeping it and postponing getting a new one until something truly better comes out, or I finally break this one beyond repair.It's small enough it slides into my sleeve cargo pocket on my uniform.It's durable enough to withstand the field, getting bucked off a couple of horses, and my nieces playing with it when visiting home.It's easy enough to use when I need to whip it out and snap a shot of whatever shenanigans are going on at the time without fidgeting with settings.It's quality of pictures keeps me happy with the pictures I take today, and the ones I took three years ago.The only feature I wish it had was a faster shutter speed: Sometimes Soldiers/pets/children are quicker than my camera and I've lost the opportunity to capture it on film before they are off and running again.One day I will retire it... but not THIS day!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Z
Reviews.Content: This camera has seen some serious abuse over the last 3 - 4 years and it still works!  Sure the motor makes a little more noise when the lens comes out and goes in, but I use this when I don't want to bring my Nikon D90 around.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: The powershot
Reviews.Author: J.Lin
Reviews.Content: Worked great for the first five years, until it broke down. I guess technology only last so long. bye canon powershot. =( you were loved.

Reviews.Title: Bought my first one in 2008 just got another off E-Bay
Reviews.Author: Patrick in Colorado
Reviews.Content: I first bought this camera after doing a ton of research.  I wanted something easy to take around with me to take pictures of my kids.  This camera is great.  Works well in all different lighting situations. It is quick in between shots.  Image stabilization helps reduce blur.My only draw back is in low light the flash is to much.All in all I was happy enough with it that after our latest vacation we got sand into our camera and it would no longer work so I bought a new one off e-bay.I did more research and why spend more money on a camera that isn't as good as this one

Reviews.Title: Canon SD 790 IS Power Shot camera
Reviews.Author: Gary Umlauf
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for over 3 years and have taken about 15,000 photos with it.  It replaced a high quality Sony F828 camera with many options.  The quality of the photos are just excellent.  As mentioned by others, you need to keep reading the manual as you learn something new every time you use it.  I bought a Nikon P90 to replace this one a year and a half ago.  I tried using that camera and it just was garbage by comparison.  The Nikon had 12 megapixels and taking the same picture under the identical conditions, the Canon was superior in every way.  So...I kept the Canon and gave away the Nikon as I would not try to sell it because it is an inferior camera.  The only problem I had with the Canon was with the small screws falling out.  Once I went to an optical company and they put different screws in it, I never had another problem.  This camera has been in Europe, and on vacations all over the country and still works as good as it did when new. It is easy to use and very durable.  I can't say enough about it.

Reviews.Title: Still works well 3 years later
Reviews.Author: aanacki
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera almost three years ago. I don't use it that often, but when I need it, it always does what it is supposed to do.  The menus are simple and logical enough that I don't have to take time to relearn the camera if I haven't used it recently.

Reviews.Title: Cant Download Photos on MAC
Reviews.Author: New Yorker "yogini"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera. I have no problems with the camera.  BUT I have a MacBook and I have had problems downloading onto my MacBook.  I googled my problem and found out lots of other people had the same problem. Lots of crazy, complicated solutions were presented.  I finally called Cannon customer service directly and they walked me through it -- turns out there is a  trick -- you have to hit the replay view button on your camera before you connect it to the computer  for the photos to show on the iCamera.  Such aggravation.  You'd think Cannon would have the foresight to make downloading as easy and user friendly as possible.

Reviews.Title: Its been around the world!!
Reviews.Author: bminer
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for over 2-3 years and its the best purchase i ever made. Its been through everything and still worked great! Friends have taken it on EuroTrips and i have taken it everywhere i went. A friend hung pictures of France in his house that were shot with this camera. I used it for four wheeling videos and its been through hell. I love the camera and will recommend to anyone. I have been searching for this camera after it was stolen from me a couple months back and finally found it again. Oh Happy Day!

Reviews.Title: great pic by sd790is
Reviews.Author: the blessed one
Reviews.Content: i got this camera for my wife and she's been happy with it. she's been mostly used for taking pics of our son from his age 1 to 3. it's very duable and well built. we dropped it a couple of times and nothing has been broken. this camera works great indoor, outdoor, snap shot, video, person, and background. i've been taken nearly 1 million pics and video, they r all good quality. we've been have this camera for more than 3 years and it has been served us faithfully.

Reviews.Title: TWO YEARS IN AND STILL THE BEST CAMERA I'VE EVER HAD
Reviews.Author: Jc Ov
Reviews.Content: had it for two years now and it still works perfect and the videos are awesome, my friends dont believe they were taken with a photo camera.ive dropped many times even on concrete and only shows some minor scratches but still works 100% its very durable.its so easy to use that mi 6yo daughter uses it all the time.i did only four stars on the display not because of quality but because if it were touchscreen then it would be perfect, but then again the screen is always clean.the charger stopped working after two years but i got it here in amazon for $13 bucks brand new in box.the battery still goes for days after two years of use.Camera has been at the beach and the desert many times, telescopic lens still works perfect.the processor is very fast, takes pictures real quick (less than one second between them)and its so compact it fits anywherethis is a great deal of a camera.if u dont get this, get a nikon, but, seriously 'get this'!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: gremmie
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for 2 years and I love it.  Its simple enough to pick up how to use it without reading the instructions, but it has a ton of great features if you want to learn to use them. I personally just use the basics and am really pleased with the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Peterson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for Sports use, mostly taking pictures, and filming sections of sporting events. Picture quality is excellent, shutter speed is great, can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!! Love it.
Reviews.Author: pepper
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. This is my 2nd Canon Powershot with the 3" display and I absolutely love it. I'm spoiled with such a big display screen, I wouldn't have anything less now. It takes great pictures and the battery life is awesome. I carry it around with me everywhere!

Reviews.Title: Don't leave home without it!
Reviews.Author: lele
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best point and shoot camera I have ever used.  The screen is large and the picture is beautiful. The camera is also easy to use, especially once you get familiar with the different settings available to you. However, a previous reviewer was correct in saying that the screws holding the camera body together can fall out.  This happened to me, causing me to drop the camera, which caused slight damage.  Although the camera still worked, I sent it into Canon to see if they could repair the body.  I had it back in less then 2 weeks, at no cost to me (except the initial shipping). I am confident I will not need another p&s; for a LONG time, and if I were to lose this one, I would just buy the same model.  Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Derek R Supple
Reviews.Content: Got the camera for my wife for her Birthday.  She wanted a small camera with a long battery life.  Professional resolution wasn't necessary but wanted high quality pictures.  So far the camera has been great.  We like the image stabilizer and the fast "time to next picture"

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: E. Driver
Reviews.Content: Camera is great.  It replaced one just like it that was lost.  Wrong camera was sent first, but they quickly sent out the correct one, and I then returned the incorrect one.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: H. Tant
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, and it well suits my needs.  The only negative attribute is that it does not work at night for distance shots.  The flash is too weak.  You have to purchase an additional flasher that is around $100.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ted R. Hill
Reviews.Content: The camera works very nicely & turns out great pictures.  It's fairly easy to use & yet is powerful. I had some difficulty finding some items in the documentation.

Reviews.Title: still learning to use
Reviews.Author: L. Robert Webb "BobinUtah"
Reviews.Content: I have not had the camera long enough to become thoroughly familiar with all of its features or any limitatins.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: G. Quattlebaum
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera because I dropped our last one on a concrete floor and fractured the lens.  I love this camera, it's easy to use, takes great pictures, has the image stability feature which in a small camera is a must.

Reviews.Title: Fast Delivery, as promised!
Reviews.Author: Camera Buyer 5 "CB5"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera - I picked this out as a middle-of-the-line camera.  I wanted something that performed better than a point and shoot without all of the added expense of a SLR.... and this camera is fantastic!!  The images can be a bit washed out with very bright sunlight, but if you spend a little time familiarizing yourself with all the options, you can more than make up for it.  In other words, great camera, great value for how expensive it is, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Love this camera...my only complaint is it is bulker than most small cameras and a bit heavier but thats probably because it has SO MANY features.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Ski Race Watcher
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for 3 weeks of summer fun and photos. The battery only just ran down, so that is a big improvement over my last digital. Also, it is easy to carry the recharger on a trip.  The stabilization feature proved itself when I got a good picture of the Grand Hotel on Mackinaw Island while driving over the bumpy bridge 4 miles away! The 'face-finding' feature is also neat. You don't have to center the picture on a person.  I'm sure there will be lots to learn, but so far, so good!

Reviews.Title: Excellent pictures, portable, easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It used to be that cameras this size were considered "snapshot" cameras that sacrificed on quality.Not true anymore. I am amazed at how great the pictures look for a camera this size and this price.I use it at work (in pathology) and this camera is very easy to use with just one hand.I think in the high-end range Nikon cameras are best. But I think for small point-and-shoot camerasn, Cannon can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Quang Luu Tran "yeah"
Reviews.Content: I've had it for 8 months now. It's a good camera. Especially the battery is supper long. The screen also very good. Recommend everybody that  not requiring very pro pics get this camera. Just 1 small problem, it's not very easy to learn and use all of its features.

Reviews.Title: Great Reliable Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Tsai
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 6 months now.  It is a great little camera that is small enough to go anywhere, but packs enough MP's to take poster sized pictures.  I've had two previous versions of the PowerShot, one being the 750.  I've purchased my 3rd one for a reason.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera! I love the look of it, the features it has...basically, just everything about it! It's definitely worth the price & so much more!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Service
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This product arrived quickly and in excellent condition.  I will order from this seller again if I have any future camera needs.

Reviews.Title: DS790 - Great Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: K-Man "K-Man"
Reviews.Content: Camera was purchased along with a separate underwater housing for mostly underwater photography in the tropics.  The camera takes amazing picture both above and below the water with just the built-in flash.  The pictures came out beautifully, even those tough ones under marginal conditions.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: A. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best point and shoot camera i have ever owned. I typically don't write about products i like, but this needs to be said. It has so many great features and the shots come out looking great. Even the video part turns out outstanding. I was shocked when I would play the video back on my computer. It's the best bang for your buck when it comes to the camera. You won't be disappointed buying this.

Reviews.Title: Small package - Big pictures
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Wacha
Reviews.Content: Some delay in delivery caused by vendor. All's well that ends well. Camera has all the bangs and whistles needed for taking fun snapshots.

Reviews.Title: SD 790 IS - The evolution of a great camera
Reviews.Author: S. MCATEE
Reviews.Content: I've been using Canon cameras since long before digital. When I moved to digital a few years back, I started with a Canon Digial Rebel XT. Great camera but too bulky to carry everywhere. So I added an SD 630 to my arsenal. That's another great camera with tons of incredible features. So now looking for something improved but familiar, I went back to the Canon Elph family of cameras. The SD790IS is no slouch and represents the natural evolution of what I was already used to - the SD630. I love this camera and am very happy with it. I have already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: Great overall point & shoot digital camear
Reviews.Author: W. Chan
Reviews.Content: Clear photos, good video function, really good macro photos. Could perhaps use some wind noise cancellation for the mic and improved clarity when zooming in video mode. I also found it to have good battery life. Much better than the (albeit old) Sony DSC-T1 I replaced with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: C. Santos
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera!! I took it on my trip and I was able to take so many great pictures.  Very fast shipping!!

Reviews.Title: Almost All Praise for this Camera
Reviews.Author: Captain Safety
Reviews.Content: Love the camera and picture quality. Beats the pants off of the comparable Nikons in it's class. Only complaint, the scroll wheel is a bit lazy in its response. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Cherbear "C. White"
Reviews.Content: I totally enjoy this camera.  I bought it for a trip and took thousands of pictures.  It takes beautiful sunset, underwater pictures & video, and floral pictures, besides the normal pictures.  I also liked the ISO3200 setting to take wildlife pictures in motion, such as butterflies, hummingbirds & bees.  I only wish the camera had a view finder like the older version.  I enjoyed the video setting, but just make sure you have a big memory card to hold all your data.  Im still learning all the camera can do for me (had it for 1 month).  It is amazing how you can take such a small camera and take award winning photos in (using the wp-dc24 waterproof case) & out of the water.  Great buy!!

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Gwendelyn
Reviews.Content: REF[[ASIN:B0011ZK6OS Canon PowerShot SD790IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom].This Canon PowerShot SD790IS has been an excellent gift for my 18 year old son.  This camera received a lot of excellent reviews and now I see why.  The SD790IS has basic functions that are easy to use right out of the box and yet is challenging enough to keep it interesting for a tech savy person.  Amazon, your delivery time was very impressive.  The camera was delivered days before the estimated delivery date.  Bravo.  You are my favorite shopping source for gift giving and personal online purchases.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Kelly
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera for the price. I had been shopping around for a long time. It takes wonderful pictures for an amateur like myself. I wanted something with a lot of megapixels so I would be "ahead" of the new technology game for at least a few months. The only problem I have is the metal outside gets fingerprints all over it easily. If you want an easy operable camera that looks good and has some bells and whistles, buy it!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Keyser Soze
Reviews.Content: Had this camera since Feb. ran a fair amount of pictures though it, works great, battery life seems to be good, the screen is good enough that i don't really miss not having a view finder, and it's still small enough to fit in my pocket. I would recommend getting a screen protector if you're going to carry it in your pocket a lot, i just got one of those thin films that they make for touchscreen cell phones and cut it to the right size for the camera screen, it's been working good so far.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Sandra V.
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier. I stick with Cannon because I've always had good results and this camera is another good one. The most important thing to me was not to have a shutter delay and this camera does well with very little delay. Takes great pictures and easy and fun to use. I'm completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Good camera at a really good price
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I am a basic point and shoot picture-taker and I'm still learning all that this camera does.  It's been really easy to operate, but I've got pages more to cover in the owner's manual.  I believe the photo quality is very good - I've taken indoor and outdoor and the zoom is good enough for my needs.  I've used it for both indoor and outdoor video and I find the quality to be really good - considering it's a camera.  The mic seems pretty sensitive as it picked up my voice from a whisper.  First thing I had to do when I got the camera was buy a card with more memory (32mg is used up in a 16 second video), and a case.  I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love My New Camera
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Sedona/Grand Canyon. It took beautiful photos, I had them uploaded to my online account, ordered canvas prints of different shots after see what the print photo looked like first. Love it. I've had canon camera's for years. I used to have a 4MP, and it's great.But, now I have the 10MP camera and love it. The expert photographers say the 12.1 is good of the canon, but the down side is the case is plastic. Upside is the wideangle is a bit better than the 10MP.However, in the long rung it's $130 more than I wanted to spend and I am so happy with my 10MP. Canon's are the best. Sony is not bad either. Nikons old and new still are awful and still slow. The moment won't wait or last when I have 10 littl 1yr - 9 yr old nieces/nephews running around.Even my old camera where you're waving your hand in mid-air is captured and not blurred. Kids jumping on the trampoline in mid-air are awesome shots. Scenic photos of islands carribean water and the beautiful red rock of Sedona are so awesome. Even snapshots of the park, gardens, and old black and white prints of buildings look amazing.From now on, no more buying artwork at best buy or online. You can print and order your own prints online for much less and they're scenes you've experienced and take with you for the rest of your life. Love love love my new canon!!Also, I spoke with camera experts at both Best Buy and B&H; photography. They agree with my camera purchase choice. If you're planning on doing much much more, then spend the extra dough. But for what I need to do and get done, this is the perfect camera for time to come. If I want to take a photography class and need a more upscale camera, I may do that, but for now this camera is perfect for the price and for the value I'm getting.If you are planning to buy this camera, thumbs up and enjoy your new camera. Again, amazing photos from all the canon cameras I've owned.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Kaufmann
Reviews.Content: I love it. I had the 7.0pixel one and it died so I upgraded there are still a lot of functions I still haven't figured out perhaps the camera is smarter than me.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: M. James
Reviews.Content: It has quite a few features, but mostly I love that you can simply point and shoot and you are close to guaranteed a fantastic picture.  Great product, will continue to purchase Canon's for sure.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I've owned so far...
Reviews.Author: J. Grimes
Reviews.Content: After a long search for a new digital camera, what caught my eye about the SD790IS was the new user interface on the back of the camera.  Instead of using the traditional buttons like my old SD630 or SD450, Canon has redesigned the UI with a touch pad wheel and flat panel keys like a cell phone.  It was very easy to get used to and its very intuitive.  It took about 5 minutes to master it.The biggest advantages on this camera were Image Stabilization, SDHC compatibility, 10 mega pixels, as well as a simple button to go to playback mode.  You don't have to slide a toggle switch like my older Canon unless you want to go to video mode like on the sd450 and sd630.Image stabilization works great.  It really guards against blurry photos when you have plenty of light.I shopped around a long time and I'm very satisfied with this camera.  The new UI is a huge improvement and I'm really happy with it.  The only drawback on this camera?  I think its time for Canon to redesign the OS and menus.  There is much more they can add.Many reviewers have mentioned the size and weight of this camera as drawbacks, but I just don't see it.  I have the SD790IS and my g/f has the SD770IS.  Side by side, her camera is the same size...it may be 1/10th of an inch slimmer overall, but the difference is really negligible.  Both cameras will fit in the same size of case.

Reviews.Title: Gift for Wife
Reviews.Author: James B. Smith "Ramblin' Wreck"
Reviews.Content: Camera works great!  Highly recommend for small sized camera.  We also have a Canon IS3 (more zoom).  Can't go wrong with Canon.

Reviews.Title: Really pleased with this camera
Reviews.Author: Romina Bin
Reviews.Content: The camera is really compact. It is very light and has a nice LCD in the back. The only thing I miss is a better zoom, but I settled with a very good macro features.I found the menu a little bit complicated at first for a point & shot camera, but then I got used to it.In addition, I'm not sure if the batteries last very much yet, I'll be able to say so in a few months.Overall, I'm very happy with this buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Brad A. Parke
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading the numerous good reviews about it.  After about 3 months of using it I am so pleased with this little camera I feel obligated to add a review of my own.I decided to upgrade from a 6mp Sony T9 after noticing that my pics from my last trip came out a bit on the soft side and lacking detail.  After taking a few test shots I was very pleased with the quality of the images the SD790 produces.  The detail is fantastic and the colors come out very true to life.  One thing that bothers me a bit though is that this camera exhibits a little corner blur in shots taken at wide angle.  This is only really a problem though when you zoom in on the corners; at normal resolution it doesn't stand out all that much.This camera has a decent amount of manual controls for a compact point and shoot.  I am especially pleased with the ability to set the shutter for long exposures (up to 15 sec) so you can actually take some pretty good night shots.While there are a few minor annoyances such as the zoom setting not being displayed and the mode selection wheel being very finicky these problems become negligible when you take into account how great the images this device captures are.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants a compact camera that you can fit in your pocket and that will take phenomenal photos.

Reviews.Title: stylish and clean
Reviews.Author: C. Knight
Reviews.Content: the camera is very stylish, especially the button design. takes very clean pictures with the variety of settings available for almost any lighting condition.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Pictures
Reviews.Author: Prasanth
Reviews.Content: It takes really good and sharp pictures.And also I like the big and bright LCD.

Reviews.Title: One of the best things I've ever bought.
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for someone who like good clear pictures worthy of being printed or emailed to someone.  This my 2nd digital camera, and boy, am I impressed.

Reviews.Title: Classical terrific
Reviews.Author: Alan B. Shipley
Reviews.Content: Great camera...bought it for my wife, she can even figure out how to take pictures.  The flash seems a bit weak, but better than previous camera. Viewing screen is really nice and is bright enough to see if it is light.  easy to carry, heavier that previous camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics
Reviews.Author: bobtrc
Reviews.Content: We own several Canon cameras and this one takes the best pictures.  The image stabilization works well.  We had three of the cameras on vacation recently and the same exact picture was taken by each camera.  The sd790is wins easily.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom
Reviews.Author: S. Hansen
Reviews.Content: The pictures from this camera are as good a quality as the pctures from the Nikon D-200, if not better. Certainly easier to carry around. Haven't played too much with the video function yet but the shot I did take I fault the photographer for not reading the directions.

Reviews.Title: A great camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Cronin
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera after doing some research.  It seemed like the Canon Powershot was the best camera in its price range and size.  We went with the 10MP Powershot camera instead of the 8MP one because the 10MP was only slightly more expensive and we figured with the rate that technology changes, we'd be outdated just that much sooner with the 8MP. So far, we've had a lot of fun figuring out the different functions and settings, and our pictures have been turning out really well.

Reviews.Title: YESYESYES
Reviews.Author: Adelaida Santos "craven raven"
Reviews.Content: well i must say that this camera is the best camera i've had yet. it takes VERY clear pictures, and has many many cool features! you MUST love this camera. its BOMMBB.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Preasent
Reviews.Author: Amy L. Haertling
Reviews.Content: It works amazing, fast start up, great pictures, and videos. Absolutely love it. It has some weight to it, which is nice. Feels like your actually holding a camera. Overall it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. R. Bowers
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement of an earlier model that went bad after 4 years.  I like this camera.  I never used the view finder, so the larger LCD screen on the back is a real nice feature.  So far so good, no problems.  I also like the metal frame of this camera.  This model is the only one I found for my needs that had a metal frame.  Again, all in all it has been a good camera so far.  If things change I will post again.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: F. Delgado
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for more than a month and I really like it.The quality of pictures is great. I used to own a 5mp Sony Cybershot that broke and I decided to try a Canon instead this time. I am really happy with my decision. Images and colors are much brighter and sharper. 3x optical zoom isn~t that great, but with a 10mp picture you can afford to make use of the digital zoom and loose some megapixels.  Night shots are awesome and the videos are better quality than my 30gb JVC hard drive camcorder.The screen is large and nice, but my wife has a hard time keeping her fingers away from it when taking pictures.The Macro function (close-up pictures) is much better than other models that I have seen.Overall, this camera is a good purchase. I feel like I've bought the perfect camera for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Best camera we have owned.
Reviews.Author: T. Schwendemann
Reviews.Content: We have owned 5 digital cameras over the last few years and this is the best one so far.  It is very hard to get a bad picture.  It is very simple to use and packed full of fun features.  My neice has the canon 1100 model and this one has a nicer feel and bigger screen.  (Go for the larger screen)  It's not as fast as some other digital camers I've used, but it is great for most users.  If I ever need to buy another digital camera, I would buy this one again.

Reviews.Title: simple yet elegant
Reviews.Author: Darrel J. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot should be everybody's primary camera.  It takes care of 99%  of picture taking challenges. Limited optical zoom is the main problem and you have to spend 200 to 300 dollars more to really solve that issue. With the 8 GB card we bought with it, we can take virtually unlimited super high quality pictures.  My son started using it without using the instructions and only came to whine once before he was satisfied enough to take it out for serious picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD790 - awesome digital camera
Reviews.Author: Bhavin Shah
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera to anyone who is searching for a digital camera under $200. It is simple and takes wonderful pictures. Next camera I buy will most likely be a Canon as well.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Gregory Streit "Greg"
Reviews.Content: The quality of the pictures is quite good for a point and shoot. Auto mode work well in most environments but most of the settings can also be set manually if needed. Screen size and clarity is the best part of the camera.  The image stabilization really seems to help. My only gripe would be that the menu features are not as friendly as I would like. But even so it is not that bad just takes few extra moments to figure out the setting that is needed.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Adcock
Reviews.Content: BUY THIS CAMERA! It takes the best pictures of any digital camera I've ever owned over the last 8 years.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot 10MP camera !!
Reviews.Author: FanOfAmazon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift but got a chance to use it. The camera takes very good pictures with a very good battery life. There is nothing more you can ask for from a camera. Perfect camera for both outdoor and indoor pictures. Really 5 star product!

Reviews.Title: Best price on Amazon
Reviews.Author: M. Canevaro "Prozac"
Reviews.Content: Our digital camera just died recently and we looked in the stores for a new camera.  The point and click Canon powershot sd 790 caught out eye since it was much better and stronger than out old one.  The price tag in the stores was $250.00 without tax.  We looked on every website and should have looked here first.  We got a great price and we have used it for a few months now and I have to say that I would have paid $250.00 for it since it is an amazing little camera but am very happy that I did not pay full price.  I won't got into details since others here will give you all the specs..but let me say that if you are interested and do your research, this camera will serve you well as it did me.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Nestor Pla, Jr. "Nespla"
Reviews.Content: I can't write a very technical review.  I just have to say that I love the camera.  Very easy to use and I just had pictures that I took enlarged to 16 by 20 posters.  Very happy with the results

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: W.P.M.
Reviews.Content: this was my first digital camera and it is great...it's easy to hold and use and has more than enough options than I need...the pictures are clear and easy to take...the 10mp is very good but not needed unless you are into photography a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the bucks
Reviews.Author: A. Alvarado
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon fan for awhile so when I wanted to replace my last Canon camera, I once again only looked at Canon.  I am very happy with whole camera .  The photos are crisp,  love the larger viewing screen, the ipodish selector is also kool as well as the modern look of the camera itself.  The only reason I do not give it a 5 star is because I don't always get a blur free photo ... most of the time yes ... but I don't know if that is common on most cameras or not.  Overall I a very happy with this purchase and I buy online mostly from Amazon!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: ChristaC "ChristaC"
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about buying a camera because I have had really bad experience with previous purchases (Casio and Nikon).  This camera turned out to be amazing and it takes wonderful pictures.  It's easy to use and it has great features!  I would definitely reccommend this to anyone looking for a great, reliable point and shoot!

Reviews.Title: Great camera! Best point-and-shoot I ever had!
Reviews.Author: Ayana April
Reviews.Content: If your looking for the "everything" point&shoot; carmera this is it. It does so much and more. It allows me to to take my random picture with friends as well as try out some interesting shots with nature and color. It's a solid piece of equipment and I'm glad I got it. The large lcd screen is pretty awesome too!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Bellman
Reviews.Content: I really can't think of anything that is wrong with this camera.  I especially love the long battery life.  Picture quality is good, compact a great everyday camera that is easy to use and puts out good pictures

Reviews.Title: All around excellent
Reviews.Author: E. Pope
Reviews.Content: Overall, it takes wonderful photos.  The only downfall is the small amount of zoom. Other than that, I am more than thrilled with my purchase! I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: A. Hanaburgh "camera junkie"
Reviews.Content: Tis camera is wonderful...I bought it right before a trip to cambodia. i thought that it would take awhile to learn but I used it right out of the box.  the pictures are awsome. it works very well in dim and night nlight.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Harokopis
Reviews.Content: This Canon camera is amazing.  It is easy to use and takes great pictures.  The camera is easy to navigate thru the options provided.  I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Phong Truong
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for a Point and Shoot.  I'm a long time Canon dSLR user and bought this for my wife as I believe in Canon products!! She loves it!!

Reviews.Title: outdated but great
Reviews.Author: streamlinesurfer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera two years ago and it has only been good to me.  While there are probably better options out there now, I love this unit!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT PURCHASE FOR THE MONEY
Reviews.Author: Bryce Heinbaugh
Reviews.Content: The canon powershot 790is in my opinion is the best camera for under $300.  it is user friendly with a beautiful LCD screen and sleek size to take practically anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Tommyild
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Lynch III
Reviews.Content: Outstanding compact camera that fits in almost any pocket, but looks like I paid more than I should have.  Check for discounts.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for all needs
Reviews.Author: Waleed El Zomor "Waleed El Zomor"
Reviews.Content: I just got the Camera few days ago but till now have no complaints. very good camera, very elegant and the video quality with the image stabilization is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Keith W. Locke
Reviews.Content: Exceltent camera takes both high quatity stills and good cleam videow both above and underwater.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: J. McBride
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It was exactly what I was looking for.  The 10 megapixel quality is amazing.  The zoom works very nicely.  I also love the different picture modes that you can use for everything from sunsets, to foliage, to indoor.  The pictures come out looking beautiful.  Also, the slim body of the camera makes it very portable.  I highly suggest the Slim Kroo Case to go along with it as well :) I put it in that durable case, and carry it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: David H. Rovine
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. I actually used it in the rain hiking the other day and it held up. Small, Compact, I love this camera, if anything it has many, many functions which take a little time to figure out. But the quality - video and picture is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Works great, excellent value
Reviews.Author: D. Krueger
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised, takes great pictures and decent video.  As with any camera nowadays, there are more features than I know what to do with.

Reviews.Title: Hooked on Canon Digital Elphs
Reviews.Author: Brandon Harris
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera from the SD450 after it was dropped and refused to operate correctly.  This camera is exceptionally stylish, all buttons are inlaid and cut from the body.  It fits very nicely in a pocket.The picture quality is a jump from the SD450, which suffered from a focus issue.  I have not taken a single out of focus picture with this camera.  The response time is what you would expect from a digital camera, I don't know if there have been any advances in this area, this is purely a limitation of the flash card.If you are looking for a camera to take along with you, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: USER3034 "USER3034"
Reviews.Content: The camera is excellant. The quality and ease of use along with the extra larger view screen make it a pleasure to own and operate. A definite value!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Aaron D. Dempsey
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera for the price.  It does especially good with close up digital macro shots.  I am completely happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD790IS
Reviews.Author: Kaci Lankford "klankymom"
Reviews.Content: Awesome compact camera that fits in your pocket or purse to take with you everywhere!! It has more features then the Canon SD850IS so it takes a little longer to get used to, but well worth the time!!! I LOVE the red eye correction feature. My son has bright blue eyes and they are red in every picture. With this feature I can edit them right then on the camera and not have to mess with photo software on the computer. I am very satisfied with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mark L. Shrader
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Easy to carry around. Easy to use. Lots of features. Best small camera I've ever owned.(I have 5)I haven't had anything bad to say about this camera. I have taken about 2000 pictures so far and they are all great. I am very pleased.If I wear this camera out, I would buy a new one!

Reviews.Title: Camera Freezes!
Reviews.Author: Linda Buckenberger
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera when I first got it. It is small with a nice display screen and takes great pictures. But after only a few months it began to freeze up on me. I would go to turn it on and the lens would open then the camera would turn off-with the lens still out! The only thing I can do is remove the battery for a few minutes then put it back in. The camera will work until next time I need to use it. Please, if anyone knows how to correct this problem please make a post. For those of you thinking of buying one I have to say that even if this camera takes the best pictures it is rendered useless if it doesn't turn on when you need it! I would strongly recommend shopping around.

Reviews.Title: Great...but...heavy, slow, short optical zoom & hard to clean
Reviews.Author: B. Weiss "BeWise"
