Reviews.Content: I have been an avid canon fan for 22 years and once again find myself with yet another quality product.  The camera has a variety of features, a convenient turn wheel for camera options, and is worth the extra price for the Image Stabilizer; because I normally shoot with a SLR (Canon 20D)I was looking for a solid camera that offered these options in a user friendly way.  This camera lives up to my expectations. However, the camera is not without its weaknesses:  it processes slow after pressing the shutter button(the same frustration with my old Canon Elph S500), it is heavy for its size, only offers 3x optical and 10MP(while others offer 5x and 12MP at comparable rates), and it is very hard to wipe off finger prints on the screen and body--even with a microfiber camera cloth (other bodies are manufactured from scratch resistant material).  It's a toss up between this model and the SD950IS, but I like the sleekness of the SD790IS and the turn wheel on the back of the camera.  It's a trade off and you'll need to decide what fits your needs.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera
Reviews.Author: J. Malecha
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a xmas gift. Although it was easy to use and had good picture quality at the beginning, the motor began to fail after 6 months of use. When it was finally unusable (would not even open), I sent it in for repair.Canon said that it was water damage, although I've been in control of the camera and its never been near water. It appears that canon will use this excuse for any component failure. For a heavy "wear and tear" type of electronics like a camera, purchase on build quality. Canon is not a good manufacturer and does not stand behind their productsIf you do buy this product, go through a vedndor who offers a 100% replacement extended warranty.Very poor construction quality.

Reviews.Title: dont bother
Reviews.Author: P. Caron "out there somewhere"
Reviews.Content: I previously owned a sd 630, and loved it, i still use it as a matter of fact. iv dropped it and beat it up for 4 years and have never had a problem and still get great pictures.  when i decided to buy a new camera i looked at another powershot and settled on this one. iv had it less than a year, and im very dissapoined with it. the picture quality is so so, for 10 MP they are not what they should be and compared to my 6 megapixle 630 the pictures are rubbish.other problems i have had with this camera are,1. unresponsive buttons that dont always do what i want them to do.2. terrible design. the screws keep falling out of it i only have two left holding the camera together3. focus is not great with a lot of my pictures coming out blurred or with a lot of noise4. sometimes the camera takes forever to actualy focus and by the time it does what i wanted to take a picture of is gone.5. it also takes some getting used to with more features then are actually nessessary and figuring out what does what when and where can take a minute.6. one of my biggest problems with this camera is that the battery pack size is different from all other sd models that i have used. generaly if i run out of juice i can plug my battery into one of my friends sd chargers or use their battery. but not with this model, very inconvenient, especialy if you forget your charger on a trip.7. iv had this happen a few times, the camera will shut off saying that the battery needs to be recharged, even if you just charged it. it will turn back on and work but its annoying when your about to take a picture and the camera dies on you.good luck with this thing...

Reviews.Title: muy bueno pero con un solo detalle
Reviews.Author: Roger Mejia
Reviews.Content: es un producto increible la pantalla es exelente el tiempo de encendido es super rapido la calidad de imagen es asombrosa y ni sedida del estavilizador de imagen y el reconocimiento de rostros lo unico que le falta es arreglar el marcador de la bateria que tiene tres palitos y cuando solo quedan dos apenas tiene menos de 20% de carga lo por lo tando si voy para una fiesta y creo que tengo full carga me puedo quedar sin baterias, por eso recomiendo comprar una bateria adicional pero marca canon las genericas tienden a deteriorarse muy rapido por eso es mejor las orijinales, por cierto fuera de esta observacion esta es una de las mejores camaras de bolsillo existente en el mercado muy buena compra la recomiendo.

Reviews.Title: This camera is handy and works great, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Becky Rose
Reviews.Content: As an avid scrapbooker, I'm obsessed with photos of my family and trips and got tired of lugging my gynormous camera around.  I purchased this camera and immediately read the directions, knowing that if I didn't I wouldn't be able to master it.  Thank goodness I did and quickly took the Powershot on a vacation to Hawaii.  It worked like a charm and I got over 410 amazing photos!The features are easy to use - the red-eye tracker, croping on the camera, etc.  I'm amazed at how much I could do without having to work on the computer.It's light enough to cart around, I keep it in my purse now - so I never miss photo opportunities.  I wish I had bought it sooner and it's competitively priced.

Reviews.Title: Superb Camera
Reviews.Author: Marie L. Virnig "Angel Girl"
Reviews.Content: Digital Photography is my number one hobby, and this is the perfect camera to make it fun!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: D. Schulte
Reviews.Content: This camera is all it is touted to be and comes at a great price.  Compared to similar products, it outshines them all.  You can't go wrong with this Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Best Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Sinojia "Camera Lover"
Reviews.Content: if you want to buy Digital Camera in limited budget, get this camera. you get more than what u have paid.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Sara Jane Keiper "Sara K."
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera, and upon first using it, thought it was great.  I took it on vacation and all the pictures in the LCD screen looked amazing.  I got home, uploaded them and had them printed, and all my pictures turned out blurry.  I checked and the settings were on the highest quality.  There are a ton of different settings, but how to use them is confusing.  I haven't had the same problems as other people with the camera falling apart.  I've owned other digital cameras in the past that have been straightforward-  very point and shoot oriented, which took far better pictures than this one.  A friend of mine and my mother also bought the same camera, and have had similar experiences.  I feel there is a way to get it to take great pictures, but it shouldn't be so hard to figure out.  I've used the camera several times since that first vacation, trying different settings, and asking people who know about cameras how to use it.  I have yet to be impressed with any of the pictures I print out.

Reviews.Title: SD 790 IS very good for its price!
Reviews.Author: Patrick Nguyen "Trance Music"
Reviews.Content: Have this camera for 2 weeks, took about 500+.Pros:-Made in Japan(not China:)-Stylish and solid-Take very beautiful pictures color(when pictures are taken at close distance with flash)-Large 3-inch LCD display-Good camera for outdoor.-Good battery lifeCons:-Slow shutter speed-Blur motion pictures(I don't see the image stabilization helps at all!)-Bad zoom lens(when taken far distance pictures, anything more than 10 meters, when you close up the picture, there are alot of noise)depend on what you use, I have a little 2 yrs old, most of the pictures I got come out blur.Price for this camera in April 2009, from $150USD to $190USD, very good price!

Reviews.Title: ok condition
Reviews.Author: cari weiss
Reviews.Content: nothing to write home about- it was not is as good shape as I expected- but I guess will do the job.  Definitely banged up and has some marks on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Had it for 4 years, still my go-to camera!
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 4 years now and I absolutely LOVE it! It takes the best pictures I have ever seen from a point and shoot. I also have a DSLR that I love, but many times I just end up using this one because it's so portable. It is light, easy to use, and highly durable.I also have a Canon underwater housing for this camera. It have taken it with me on 50+ dives over the past few years and have never been disappointed. Great underwater shots!The only feature I would have liked to see is optical zoom in movie mode. Excellent photo/video quality more than makes up for this minor deficiency.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Not the Sellers Fault
Reviews.Author: fiestylilsunny
Reviews.Content: I purchased a canon camera from this seller to replace the exact same one I had prior that was having trouble with the battery compartment door.  I rec'd it promptly, sooner than expected.....seller followed up to assure I was happy.  I am happy with the seller, would buy from him again but will not buy the canon powershot 790 as the new camera had the same problems! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: nice camera, terrible picture quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Kelsey R. Christenson "rubberduckey"
Reviews.Content: I've owned at least 5 different digital cameras, and as far as the quality of pictures is concerned, this one is the worst. I can never get a clear picture, even with a tripod. The only time pictures come out even relatively clear is with the flash, which discolors the pictures. This wouldn't be that big of a deal if this was a cheap camera, but when I bought it a year and a half ago it was pretty pricey, and I expected better from the powershot line.Other than the picture quality, it would be an excellent camera. It's pretty user friendly, although there's not as many pre-programmed settings as other cameras i've had. It's also nicely built, small, but by no means the smallest out there. Mine has taken quite a beating and it still works like it did when I bought it.Overall I was disappointed, both because of the price for the poor quality of the photos, and because the powershot that I had owned previously was so much better. I expected so much more from canon, and I wish I'd returned it when I got it.

Reviews.Title: great camera at an outstanding price!
Reviews.Author: TRH
Reviews.Content: I've only had the camera for a couple of weeks now, but so far so good.  The good is this: great price.  i paid $159.00 on amazon when everyone else was still charging $175-$199, start up time is incredibly quick, the 3 inch screen on the back is brilliant, the sound on the video function is surprisingly clear, and the picture quality surpasses my expectations.  The biggest negative is the button layout.  The buttons are tricky, hard to press, and at times, it is unclear what button one is actually pressing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Branko Zabala
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I've had Canon for a long time and this one seems to be the best. The feature of time for night shots is awesome and the camera itself is very sleek and elegant.Before this I had the SD750 and the only thing I like best about this camera is the size. If the SD790 would be a little bit smaller or leaner it would be a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - price keeps falling!
Reviews.Author: Rick E. Ruge "Read The Reviews"
Reviews.Content: Do you have to have a 3 inch LCD and 10 Meg CCD with no optical viewfinder?  Do you have $150?  This is your camera!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Don Jr
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. I actually like it better than my Rebel XTI and I use it a lot more often. It's easy to navigate through the menu, possibly because it's simialr to my DSLR. There's so much to like about this camera and the build quality is amazing. It's metal, not plastic like our old Olympus.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Bobby "Bobby"
Reviews.Content: i got this camera to replace one i dropped in the pool. i am very happy the camera. it takes great shots and battery lasts for ever.

Reviews.Title: Quit working after 1 month
Reviews.Author: Lila
Reviews.Content: Took great pictures for about a month now won't even turn on.  I wouldn't recommend....Canon does not stand behind their products either.  They want a fortune to fix (more than I paid for camera).

Reviews.Title: Cute camera, has issues
Reviews.Author: Jana
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last week after quite a bit of research, but had problems with it almost immediately. After taking a few pics and turning the camera on and off a few times, the camera froze and wouldn't turn back on. I ejected and re-inserted the battery, which seemed to fix the problem. However, the camera got stuck "on" a few hours later - would continue to take pics but could not be turned off.I haven't seen any other mention of this particular problem (only the 'fatal lens error'), so I'm going to exchange it for the same model. Would consider another model (especially Nikon) if these problems continue, but they are a little juvenile-looking.

Reviews.Title: So disappointing
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Walker
Reviews.Content: I had a powershot for years so when my old one broke, I naturally gravitated towards this one. It's been an awful disappointment. It's so bad we just let our kids use it to play with.  Grainy, color is off, and the focus is horrible.

Reviews.Title: Very nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Ted from Chartley "Ted from Chartley"
Reviews.Content: It may end up with 5 stars as we are just learning to us the features ( it has many)

Reviews.Title: Poor quality when set on Auto and Terrible red eyes
Reviews.Author: Goran J. "EPL Fan"
Reviews.Content: I find picture quality in Auto Mode very disappointing. I am sure there is a way to improve it through one of hundreds of adjustable settings but if you are casual photographer like me this camera may not be the best option.Specially inside, when using flash, picture comes out washed-out and very dark. Outside pictures on a cloudy day are slightly better. We have twin babies and take a lot of pictures inside, needless to say, my wife is very disappointed.Another major issue I have with this model is terrible red eyes kids have in the pictures taken with flash. It is not that bad with the adults who can stare at the camera for few seconds prior to taking picture but if you want to take pictures of kids I would definitely avoid this camera. Specially if you have little kids stay away from this model.Minor annoyance is that you can put time stamp on the picture only if you lower quality to 2 MP.On the good side, it is very fast, it takes pictures almost instantaneously and battery lasts forever. Pictures outside on sunny day are beautiful.In my experience, if you are not interested in learning much about theory of photography and all you want to do is take nice pictures with camera straight out of the box I would not recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Died after 3.5 weeks, of which 1 of it was in use and the rest turned off
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: The vendor (Pavilion) was very good at shipping it as promised, I paid a little extra to get it the next day so no complaints there.  I went to Chicago and used it for a week.  I'm no camera expert but the pictures and video came out very crisp and the quality was better than I had expected.  Very happy with the extra options as well.  I had taken some pictures in the park with lots of greenery and the foliage selection does indeed make a difference.  The colors were just so natural and crisp when compared to the regular portrait option.  I also liked the Color accent where only one color is shown and the rest is in black and white.  This gives the photos a nice artistic touch.  The camera was also very good at taking pictures with not much light, something my other camera (Kodak) had trouble with.  This thing starts up very quick, seriously about half a second after pressing the power button it's ready so you won't have trouble at getting that unexpected picture during your picture taking.  I highly recommend getting a Class 6 card because it cuts the time of copying pictures and video by about half the time.Now, for the unfortunate...I was planning on taking my new camera (mind you this is a few weeks later) so I turned it on when all of a sudden the LCD display showed snow and it shut off on me.  I figured well, the battery might have run out of juice and I was a little concerned because the lens stayed out.  No worries, I charged the battery for about an hour, just enough to get the lens back in.  Popped the battery back in, hit the On/Off button...nothing.  The camera was dead.  I do remember a canon having the same symptom but can't remember the model number.  I purchased the camera on May 26 and this happened on June 25 so I immediately sent for an RMA request and packaged the camera and would send it out the next day.Amazon was at no fault and made the return process extremely simple. I was given a refund for the total amount PLUS what I had paid to have it shipped to their facility!  I'll be getting another Canon for sure just not this model.

Reviews.Title: OK camera, not the greatest for the price
Reviews.Author: K. B. Brown
Reviews.Content: This camera does the job, but is a classic example of the pitfalls of online shopping (and not researching).  It is bigger and bulkier than many other pocket Canons, has a ridiculously long delay on shots, but costs the same (roughly) as other Canons I've had.  I made the mistake of not carefully researching the specs, just figured it would be like my other Canon I had to return for lens error.

Reviews.Title: Not great for indoor pics
Reviews.Author: Imran Khalid "ik"
Reviews.Content: I had a cheaper kodak...i wanted to try a camera which is better and would especially get great pics indoors...this camera works ok for indoor pics when used without flash...the problem is that both the camera and the objects have to be very still for the pic to come good, especially hard with quick shots and kids...outdoors works great but so do the cheaper ones...

Reviews.Title: Not bad, still getting used to it
Reviews.Author: Pistol
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon about a month ago to replace a 4 yr old Kodak.  I went with this camera for the great reviews on multiple sites and because of the Canon brand.  I don't intend to take a ton of pictures, but wanted something that could fit in a pocket and take good, quality pictures.  The price being around $200 was good for me and the 3" LCD screen is great for viewing.I did find the flash a bit annoying at first, but maybe that's because of my ignorance.  It took me a while to figure out I had to push the button half way down to focus the lens on the subject and then take the picture.  I was getting frustrated since I was trying to take pictures of my son and by the time the picture actually took, he was almost out of the frame.  I think I'm getting the hang of it now.  Pictures look good, not as great as I hoped.  Took some video at a children's concert and that looked good for a point-and-shoot camera.  Hope to learn the camera some more!

Reviews.Title: A heavy camera with a great LCD screen but  a lousy clickwheel
Reviews.Author: NK "NK"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a lot heavier than all the Sony Point and Shoot cameras i have used until now.Here is a summary of the positives and negativesPOSITIVES1. Great 3 inch LCD screen2. Fast startup3. Uses  SDHC cards so you can use an 8GB or 16GB and never worry about memory full4. Value Price5. Compact and lightweight battery charger with worldwide 100 ~220v compatabilityNEGATIVES1. Horrible Rotating Wheel. Many of the functions you can use the click wheel, but for the selections you have to use the rotating wheel, it is a nightmare getting use to this2.Lag time to shoot is still slow, a common problem with compact point and shoots3. No touch screen4. Not slim - Stubby and a wee bit heavy5. If you don't like the ubiquitous silver color - no other choice

Reviews.Title: I'm torn
Reviews.Author: HDelta "DBR"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pics but the controls are so clunky, I feel like I have mittens on every time I try and adjust the settings.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error. Restart Camera -- Flaw in Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Anderson
Reviews.Content: My parents bought me this camera about a month and a half ago and while I liked the various advanced features it offered, the camera is much more complex than I would have wanted. There is a bit of a learning curve involved in figuring out the different modes and options, and I feel that this camera is for the more advanced user, as opposed to the casual photographer.My main complaint about this camera, however, is that after having dropped it once (while the camera was on and the lens was open), the camera gave me a "Lens Error. Restart Camera" message and the camera would not function again, no matter what I tried! Apparently this is flaw on most models of Canon cameras (also known as the e18 error) and it will now cost $100+ to replace the lens!This camera might have great reviews for its quality of images, various features and overall performance; however, it certainly does not deserve any praise for its durability. Beware, if you happen to drop this camera, the very same lens error might happen to you!

Reviews.Title: BLURRRRRR BAD
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: I did not like this camera at all. the pics are fuzy not sharp pictures. i got this camera because everybody gave 5 stars but this camera is not worth 5 stars to me. i think the kodak m1033  did a better job. but i just got the canon sx110 and there is a lots of difference on the cameras. get the sx110 for similar price you will be happier.

Reviews.Title: not sure yet
Reviews.Author: Karen Caplan "KC"
Reviews.Content: I gave my son this video camera because his audio-visual class teacher recommended it.  Perhaps we are not computer-savvy enough, but we're having difficulty figuring out how to work with the camera and our PC.  We do have the firewire port, which I made sure about having read the previous reviewers.The jury's still out.  I am hoping my son's teacher will help us figure it out.  But I can say for sure that it's not all so simple.

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: Andrew N. Aldrich "aaldrich"
Reviews.Content: The first time I turned it on the screen lit up and the lens came out. It then immediately flashed across the screen "lens error. restart camera" and turned itself off with the lens still out. Every time I subsequently turned it on it came on for a second flashed the same message and turned off immediately. Taking the battery or memmory card out did nothing. Tech support confirmed the error was "fatal".Basically the thing broke in a unfixable way within seconds of it first being turned on.If it was possible to give negative stars in this reveiw I would be.DONT BUY THIS

Reviews.Title: SD790 is vulnerable to the dreaded 'Lens error, restart camera'
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "RedRocks"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on the excellent recommendations from Ken Rockwell's site, as well as the Amazon reviews.  However, upon receiving it, I got the 'Lens Error, restart camera' error and the camera is not able to take pictures.I might up the rating when I receive a new one - this one is heading back to Amazon.
